full_text: Page 3759 MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET ZA TIER-K DATE: 08/10/2019 TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE 12:00-12:30 AM 1207 1208 (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) 8:00-8:30 AM 4:00-4:30 PM 12:30- 1:00 AM 1209 1210 8:30- 9:00 AM 4:30-5:00 PM 1:00-1:30 AM 109 110 9:00-9:30 AM 5:00 -5:30 PM 1:30-2:00 AM 137 138 9:30-10:00 AM 5:30-6:00 PM 2:00-2:30 AM 267 268 10:00-10:30 AM 6:00-6:30 PM 2:30-3:00 AM 211 242 10:30-11:00 AM 6:30-7:00 PM 3:00-3:30 AM 207 308 11:00-11:30 AM 7:00-7:30 PM 3:30-4:00 AM 341 342 11:30-12:00 AM 7:30-8:00 PM 4:00-4:30 AM 414 45 12:00-12:30 PM 8:00-8:30 PM 4:30-5:00 AM 438 12:30- 1:00 PM 9:00-9:30 PM 5:00-5:30 AM 504 54 1:00-1:30 PM 9:30-10:00 PM 5:30-6:00 AM 539 540 1:30-2:00 PM 10:00-10:30 PM 6:00-6:30 AM 608 609 2:00-2:30 PM 10:30-11:00 PM 6:30-7:00 AM 2:30-3:00 PM 11:00-11:30 PM 7:00-7:30 AM 3:00-3:30 PM 11:30-12:00 PM 7:30-8:00 AM 3:30-4:00 PM MORNING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) DAY WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT EVENING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented. REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN DOJ-OGR-00027074

TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE
MORNING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT DAY WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT EVENING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT

A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented.
REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN

additional_notes: The document is a 30-minute check sheet for inmates in a special housing unit at MCC New York. It contains handwritten entries and signatures. The document is stamped with the MCC New York logo.
